preamble: In this section you will describe hardware choices such as model of amplifier, cap and electrodes used in the study, triggers and additional devices used.
question: How were the EEG electrodes placed?
What kind of cap or net did you use?
Please specify your cap or net manufacturer
Please indicate the cap or net model.
Manufacturer of the electrodes
Model of electrodes
Did electrodes have pre-amplifiers?
choices: no - passive electrodes | yes - active electrodes

question: What material were electrodes made of?
Specify the material that the electrodes were made of.
Type of conductive medium used other than listed.
choices: conductive gel | saline solution | adhesive paste | none (dry electrodes) | other

question: Conductive medium type other than listed.
Make (brand) of the amplifier
Specify which make (brand) of the amplifiers did you use.
Model of amplifier
Source of triggers
choices: photo diode | auditory trigger/voice key | combination stim tracker | presentation software trigger | other

question: Source of triggers other than listed.

Describe your trigger signal input. Were your triggers delivered during acquisition (e.g., triggers from photo diode simultaneously recorded while presenting trials) or added after recording (e.g. after analysis of an audio recording of spoken responses)?
choices: Online, during acquisition | Added after recording

question: Were your triggers delivered to the amplifier or acquisition computer?
Were your triggers delivered via an analogue or digital signal format?
choices: Analogue (e.g., via a parallel port, serial port, or TCP/IP) | Digital (including serial port over a USB port (arduino, LabJack U3, or similar))

question: Do you have other devices (eg. signal boxes, converters, other peripheral devices) to report?
Describe which additional devices you used, and specify their manufacturers and models.
